channel.title: Wienke Giezeman on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: LoraWAN and The Things Network
item.description: LoraWAN is a long range low power wireless network designed for the Internet of Things. In Amsterdam, it’s the protocol of choice for The Things Network, a public access network that uses a chunk of wireless spectrum (858 Mhz) that’s licensed there for public use. Devices on that network are served by a dozen gateways that cover the entire city. Wienke Giezeman is the point of contact for this network and there is a Facebook network to discuss expansion to other cities.
